text:
FIR registered in connection with #Vignesh Custodial Death case has details of injuries on Vignesh’s body

But the CM’s statement in the assembly mentions nothing about it

Were crucial details regarding injuries were deliberately hidden from the CM?   

https://t.co/Obd32ufGjq

I know there is much more to do - but we can only do it with YOU in our team. Your support will make us stronger, our work better. 

Support independent journalism by becoming a TNM Member: https://t.co/R1UzjSoHpM

We’ve brought you important insights through our everyday reporting too, be it the inner workings of the AIADMK regarding Sasikala, inside story of I-T raids on Kollywood producers or the questionable ways BJP uses Namo app to raise money.

As a result, the case has been transferred to the CB-CID and three cops have been suspended.

https://t.co/vD5CwV2nM1

Few days ago, Vignesh, a man offering horse rides at the beach in Chennai, died in police custody. The police tried to hush it up. I reported on this, exposing the police’s attempts to hide the irregularities connected with the custodial death. 

https://t.co/beaKANamVH

On seeing this, the Tamil Nadu Chief Minister promised all assistance to the families.

https://t.co/p8TejduEZT

7 years ago, 20 daily wage labourers from TN were shot dead in AP by an anti-smuggling task force. Till today, the families have received neither justice nor compensation. The voices of these families were brought out in a video report I did. 

https://t.co/NpFPTqpnD2

It has only been two months since I joined @thenewsminute, and it feels rewarding to do stories that touch a chord with people, inform them better, and make a difference in their lives.
